issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body:
there's a dead lock in NMClient. 
In NMClientImpl#startContainer, it first grabs "startingContainer" lock, and if exception happens, it calls removeStartedContainer which grabs "NMClient" lock. 
On the other hand, if NMClient is stopping in the meantime, it first calls cleanupRunningContainers which takes "NMClient" lock, and then calls stopContainer which takes "container" lock. Thus, deadlock.
Tentatively targeting all unreleased versions..
[~jianhe], is it possible to get this in within a week for 2.7.3? Let me know if you need any help. Tx

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks [~jianhe] for working on the patch. Nice issue!!:-)

Making clear to folks before giving +1 that since NMClientImpl is annotated as @Private, removing protected method should not  be any compatible issue.

+1 LGTM, if there is no objections I will commit it EOD
Updated the summary to reflect actual issue.
committing shortly
[~jianhe] Can you check test failures please. I checked the test case logs, it seems unrelated to this patch. Can you also check and confirm please.
[~rohithsharma], thanks for reviewing , I checked the tests, they are not related.

The patch looks fine to me too.

Not related to this patch but I see both startedContainers.putIfAbsent() and startedContainers.put() in addStartingContainer(), that is duplicated and unnecesary?
Yes, this can be optimized!

thanks for the reviews, 
removed that duplicate call
